block.p: In his interview with Michael Chabon (Sept. 24), author of ''The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay,'' Lewis Buzbee describes Jack Kirby as the creator of Captain America. While Kirby did invaluable work on the series, Captain America is actually the brainchild of the legendary comic book creator Joe Simon, the first editor of Marvel Comics. In fact, we represent Joe, now 87, in connection with his termination of the grant of copyright in Captain America; he is scheduled to recapture copyright from Marvel on Dec. 7, 2001, the 60th anniversary of the bombing of Pearl Harbor.
Ethan Horwitz Ross J. Charap New York
